subject: Gardening
title: Planting by the Moon: Fact or Fiction?
description: One-minute skill: Planting by the Moon: Fact or Fiction?.

hook.text: Lunar planting calendars say the moon's phase affects seed germination. Millions of gardeners follow them.

buildup.text: The theory: waxing moon increases sap flow upward (plant leaves), waning moon sends energy to roots.

discovery.text: Multiple controlled studies have tested lunar planting. Most found no statistically significant difference in yields.

twist.text: A few studies found marginal effects on water absorption. The moon does influence tidal forces, even in soil moisture.

climax.text: Lunar planting remains unproven but not impossible. The effect, if any, is too small to matter compared to soil, water.

punchline.text: The moon moves oceans. Moving your carrots? Unproven.

quiz.question: What do controlled studies generally show about lunar planting?
options: Strong evidence that moon phases increase yields by 30%
No statistically significant difference in yields between moon phases
Definitive proof that lunar planting damages root crops
